name: The Stables at Henham Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Stables is simply in one of the most stunning parks in the UK, and it's one of the best conversions of a Grade 2 building in the UK. Nick and his staff do an excellent job in running the whole operation - really welcoming, good breakfasts and providing lots of local information - walks, attractions, restaurants....
reviews.title: One of the very best B&Bs in the UK

reviews.text: We've stayed in a lot of places, and will write critical reports if we think there are problems and value for money issues, so, of course, others would benefit - we benefit from other contributors! However, in the case of The Stables we unreservedly recommend staying there - it's one of the very best B&Bs in the UK.
reviews.title: Only place to stay near to Southwold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only criticism is that a shower would be great. This must no put you off. Here is the low-down. We stay and have stayed, business and leisure, in a number of great hotels and venues. The Stables is right up there,! This is no ordinary B&B, this is a real gem where Nick and the team do a first-class job to make your stay especially wondrous. Whatever your reason for visiting this area The Stables should be your first choice - honestly. A walk down to the enchanting lake on the country estate is a must too.
reviews.title: Top place to stay - a real find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a extended weekend break to Southwold and thought that staying in a estate park would be great, because I wanted to see the free wandering horses. The location is stunning and peaceful and we stayed in the smaller room but it was lovely with a huge bath. It was a very relaxed stay with attentive but not in your face owners who made it a pleasure. Breakfast was really quite excellent, with thought gone into the menu. Good selection of DVDs and the honesty bar and snacks in the games room where a nice idea. I think this is definitely on my list of a fabulous B&B's and I would recommend it. There are complimentary brownies in reception which we could not help taking when we came back in of an evening to go with a cup of tea. The location is not too far from Southwold and is worth it if you want to get away from it for a bit. Bedrooms were very tasteful shabby chic just my cup of tea. Just wish I lives in this part of the world as people are just so friendly not what I am used to living in Leamington Spa.
reviews.title: fabulous and unique B&B

reviews.text: my partner and I made a last minute booking at The Stables, Henham Park - as per the other reviews and ratings - it really is quite special, simple, spacious, tranquil and with discreet but excellent service and hosting. Very comfy bed in Minsmere room - small fridge in room would be a bonus (plenty of space) but only suggestion for improvement.
reviews.title: Highly recommend this beautiful spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot believe this place, it was perfect from the start. If you want the perfect host (available at all times and yet invisible at the same time), if you want quiet, relaxation, countryside, space, comfort, its all here. The breakfast was beautifully served with everything freshly cooked and plentiful, around the large dining room table with other guests. Because its situated on a private estate, you have permission to take a walk around the lake and around the wood following the markers, all making a perfect morning! Well done Nick, you obviously put in a lot of hard work, but make it look effortless! Cannot recommend it highly enough!
reviews.title: QUIET QUIET AND MORE QUIET

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Stables is surrounded by beautiful large country house grounds and is very tranquil. The accommodation has been converted to four very large bedrooms with en-suite with rustic charm provided by the masses of oak beams.
reviews.title: Perfect host - idyllic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very reasonably priced considering the grandeur of the rooms and food and host were quite perfect. I would give this an overall six out of five!
reviews.title: Best B&B we've stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A simply wonderful stay - quiet location, excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently stayed overnight at The Stables and loved it! We've stayed in high quality B&B's before but this was in a different league. It is grand but welcoming and Nick, the proprietor couldnt do enough to help. We loved the peaceful, rural location and it's less than 10mins from Southwold. The views from our bedroom were fantastic and it was lovely to wake up looking out over the park with horses & sheep grazing & lambs playing. The breakfast was fab & there was a good selection to choose from. Everything had been thought of with regard to making your stay comfortable & enjoyable for example; home made brownies freely available, walking passes and maps for the park were provided, a dvd library, free pool table, even a jug for washing your hair in the bath & the offer of a lift if you want to go out anywhere in a 10 mile radius (for a small fee which is fair enough)! We will definitely be back - well worth the money and for us, far better than an equivalent priced hotel.
reviews.title: Little hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nick was extremely helpful when we booked and that continued throughout our stay, offering us lifts in the back of his truck whenever we needed and nothing was too much trouble (providing us a torch for our late night ramble etc!).
reviews.title: Perfect country retreat but by the sea - we loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is set in a beautiful park with grazing sheep, ancient oak trees and a pleasant woodland walk to the nearby village. We wanted a weekend of rest and relaxation and that was exactly what we got. It was peaceful (silent even), clean, breakfast was beyond excellent with views out onto the park as we muchned our eggs benedict. The room was stunning, the bed comfortable, beamed ceilings and a big big bath. We were concerned that without a car we'd struggle but it was a relaxed 30 minute walk through the park to the villlage where it was then a ten minute bus ride to southwold. Getting to the hotel from the train station was about £12 in a taxi.
reviews.title: almost perfect weekend get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our weekend and loved Southwold and would recommend anyone to stay here.
reviews.title: I felt like the Lord of the Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a weekend away from the craziness of London and stumbled across Henham Park online..
reviews.title: peaceful setting

description: Retreat from the world at our luxury boutique bed and breakfast near Southwold set in 800 acres of private parkland.
